en: Beware of imitations.
Hypocrisy is my abhorrence.
Hypocrisy is the homage that vice pays to virtue.
I don't need fake friends.
Experience without learning is better than learning without experience.
ko: 배움 없는 경험이 경험 없는 배움보다 나아.

en: When the cat is away, the mice will play.
Even the hard-hearted can be moved to tears.
ko: 마음이 차가운 사람도 눈물을 흘릴 때가 있어.

en: Fortune is the rod of the weak, and the staff of the brave.
ko: 운은 약한 자에겐 회초리고, 용감한 자에겐 지팡이야.

en: There's no telling what kind of trouble this proposal might stir up. The result is certainly going to be something to see.
ko: 이 제안이 어떤 소동을 일으킬지 몰라. 결과가 진짜 볼만하겠다.

en: In the days of the knights, they wore shields to protect themselves from sword-fight wounds.
ko: 기사 시대에는 칼싸움 부상을 막으려고 방패를 썼어.

en: The prospect of famine hangs over many areas of the world.
ko: 세계 곳곳에 기근의 위험이 도사리고 있어.

en: Because of the famine, the cattle starved to death.
Disease and famine go together.
Can you share food with others in the face of famine?
ko: 기근 앞에서도 다른 사람들과 음식을 나눌 수 있어?

en: Famine caused great distress among the people.
ko: 기근 때문에 사람들이 정말 고생 많았어.

en: I might as well drown as starve.
ko: 굶어 죽느니 차라리 물에 빠져 죽는 게 낫겠어.

en: Hunger knows no law.
Hunger is one of the strongest griefs.
ko: 배고픔은 가장 큰 고통 중 하나야.

en: Hunger impelled him to crime.
We can say that Japan was fighting a constant battle against hunger during the war.
ko: 전쟁 중에 일본은 계속 배고픔이랑 싸웠다고 볼 수 있지.

en: It is sad that so few people give money to help the hungry.
ko: 배고픈 사람들을 돕는 데 돈을 내는 사람이 너무 적어서 슬퍼.

en: Shine on my brilliant soul.
I gasped with surprise at the horrible picture of the starving people.
ko: 굶주린 사람들의 끔찍한 사진을 보고 숨이 턱 막혔어.

en: All that glitters is not gold.
It was a bright and clear Sunday morning.
You should be alert to the possible dangers.
ko: 위험할 수도 있으니까 정신 똑바로 차려야 해.

en: You need not have woken me up.
Time to get up.
It is too early to get up.
Do get up, it's very late.
Get up!
What is done cannot be undone.
ko: 이미 벌어진 일은 되돌릴 수 없어.

en: Go to the hospital.
You are beautiful.
You are her daughters.
You are teachers.
You are human.
You are actresses.
You like rain, don't you?
You are the only one.
You are doctors.
I'll always love you, no matter what happens.
ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 항상 널 사랑할게.

en: Didn't you hear her speaking French?
ko: 걔가 프랑스어 하는 거 못 들었어?

en: You are much too kind to me.
Do you know how to use a personal computer?
You lent a book.
You'll go to school tomorrow.
You have a telephone.
You go to the Chikushi river.
You are my best friend.
You like Kawaguchi.
You like elephants.
You have three cars.
Do you study chemistry?
You drink tea.
You study English.
You are a doctor.
You like balls.
You are a tennis player.
We'll leave as soon as you are ready.
ko: 준비 다 되는 대로 바로 출발하자.

en: Let us know when you'll arrive.
Put your affairs in order.
What's your shoe size?
Your shoes want mending.
I've been anxious to meet you.
What's your home address?
I have some appreciation of your problems.
ko: 네 고민이 뭔지 어느 정도 이해해.

en: She rushed to the office, and was ushered right into an examination room.
ko: 그녀는 급히 병원으로 달려가서 바로 진료실로 안내받았어.

en: She was very shy about her emergency problem, and asked the gynecologist to please examine her.
ko: 그녀는 갑작스러운 문제 때문에 많이 부끄러워하며 산부인과 의사에게 진찰을 부탁했어.

en: Your tap water is too hard. Get a water softener.
ko: 수돗물이 너무 세다. 연수기 하나 들여놔.

en: You have tennis elbow. Soak your arm in warm water.
ko: 테니스 엘보네. 팔을 따뜻한 물에 좀 담가봐.

en: Your daughter's on drugs.
ko: 네 딸 약 하는 것 같아.

en: Your dog has worms. Give him vitamins.
ko: 강아지한테 기생충 있어. 비타민 좀 먹여.

en: Thank you again for your kind assistance.
You have been a great mentor to me.
He was created a peer.
I'd like to check some of my valuables.
Will you keep my valuables for me, please?
Could you hold these valuables?
ko: 이 귀중품들 좀 맡아 줄 수 있어?

en: Can I deposit valuables here?
A valuable object decreases in value if it is damaged.
Put your valuables in the safe.
The valuables are in the safekeeping of the bank.
You should keep your valuables in a safe place.
She kept her valuables in the bank for safety.
ko: 그녀는 안전을 위해 귀중품을 은행에 보관했어.

en: Please check your valuables at the front desk.
That'll make for a memorable time.
ko: 정말 기억에 남는 시간이 될 거야.

en: Can you spare me a few minutes of your valuable time?
ko: 귀한 시간 좀 내줄 수 있어?

en: Would you please send me details of your products via e-mail as an attachment?
ko: 제품 상세 내용을 이메일 첨부 파일로 좀 보내줄래?

en: I'm very impressed with your quality control.
We would like to distribute your product in Japan.
If the quality of your product meets with our customer's approval, we will place regular orders.
ko: 제품 품질이 고객들 마음에 들면 정기적으로 주문할게.

en: What is the percentage of overseas markets for your products?
ko: 네 제품의 해외 시장 비중이 얼마나 돼?

en: I'd like some information about your new computers.
ko: 새로 나온 컴퓨터 정보 좀 알고 싶어.

en: I learned about your portable copier at the Tokyo-Office '97 Expo.
ko: 97년 도쿄 오피스 박람회에서 네 휴대용 복사기 얘기 들었어.

en: It was a great pleasure for me to meet many associates of your company.
ko: 네 회사 동료들을 많이 만날 수 있어서 정말 좋았어.

en: Please tell me the closest station to your office.
Your technical manager arranged a meeting for 1:00 p.m. on April 6, but how about April 7, at 10:00 a.m.?
ko: 기술 매니저가 4월 6일 오후 1시로 회의를 잡았는데, 4월 7일 오전 10시는 어때?

en: Please indicate what action you will take.
Please change your database to reflect the new address as follows.
ko: 주소가 바뀌었으니까 데이터베이스에 반영 좀 해주세요.

en: We are afraid that our new address is not registered on your database.
ko: 데이터베이스에 저희 새 주소가 등록이 안 되어 있는 것 같아요.

en: We are interested in your service.
We have considered your proposal, and we have decided that we are not able to reduce the price.
ko: 제안 주신 거 검토해 봤는데, 가격을 낮춰드리기는 어려울 것 같아요.

en: In reply to your request, we offer you an extra discount of 5% on this order.
ko: 요청하신 대로 이번 주문은 5% 추가 할인해 드릴게요.

en: We have given your order highest priority.
ko: 주문하신 건 최우선으로 처리해 드리고 있어요.

en: I would appreciate it if you could reserve a room at a convenient location for visiting your office.
ko: 사무실 방문하기 편한 곳으로 숙소 좀 예약해 주시면 감사하겠어요.

en: We appreciate the opportunity you've given us to learn more about your organization.
ko: 귀사에 대해 더 자세히 알 수 있는 기회를 주셔서 감사해요.

en: We would like to ask your help in clearing up our financial problems with your company.
ko: 귀사와의 재정적인 문제를 해결하는 데 도움을 좀 받고 싶어요.

en: I would like to come and see you.
Any orders you place with us will be processed promptly.
Please inform us as to what quantity you can deliver at regular intervals.
ko: 정기적으로 어느 정도 물량을 공급해 주실 수 있는지 알려주세요.

en: Here is our answer to your fax message dated April 1st.
We believe that you will be able to make a price concession.
ko: 가격을 좀 조정해 주실 수 있을 거라고 믿어요.

en: Please do not touch the record side.
Records certify that Bob passed his driving test.
ko: 기록을 보니 밥이 운전면허 시험에 합격했더라고요.

en: The monument was set up in the park.
On top of the statue, Sadako is holding a golden crane over her head.
ko: 동상 꼭대기에서 사다코가 머리 위로 황금 학을 들고 있어요.

en: The commemorative ceremony ended with the closing address.
The press besieged the minister with questions.
Reporters do not hesitate to intrude into people's privacy.
During the press conference, the President touched on foreign relations.
ko: 기자회견 중에 대통령이 외교 관계에 대해 언급했어요.

en: The reporter shot questions at the politician.
The reporter took down everything that was said.
ko: 기자는 나온 말들을 하나도 빠짐없이 받아 적었어요.

en: The journalist was too upset to distinguish vice from virtue.
ko: 그 기자는 너무 흥분해서 선악을 구분하지 못했어요.

en: The reporter covered the gas explosion in Shibuya.
ko: 그 기자가 시부야 가스 폭발 사고를 취재했어요.

en: The reporter criticized the politician.
The reporter refused to name his sources.
She cried bitterly at a press interview.
The press is interested in his private life.
A reporter is interviewing Dr. Patterson about Koko, a talking gorilla.
ko: 기자가 패터슨 박사님과 말하는 고릴라 코코에 대해 인터뷰 중이에요.

en: Reporter: Can you give me an example?
ko: 기자: 예를 하나 들어주실 수 있나요?

en: How did she tell them?
Did she hurt that kitten?
ko: 그녀가 그 새끼 고양이를 다치게 했나요?

en: Reporter: Did you buy her a kitten?
I read about All Ball.
Most people think that gorillas are stupid. Is that true?
ko: 대부분의 사람은 고릴라가 멍청하다고 생각하는데, 그게 사실인가요?

en: The article's tone was one of pessimism.
The length of the article is not to exceed 1000 words.
She has a good memory, too.
My memory is failing.
A good memory is his weapon.
It is still fresh in my memory.
People who regularly work in the open air do not suffer from sleeplessness.
ko: 야외에서 정기적으로 일하는 사람들은 불면증에 시달리지 않아요.

en: Regular exercise is beneficial to good health.
I believe in exercising regularly.
ko: 저는 규칙적으로 운동하는 게 중요하다고 생각해요.

en: You should practice playing the piano regularly.
An orderly lifestyle and a regular diet are the keys to health.
Those who violate the rules will be punished.
ko: 규칙을 어기는 사람은 처벌을 받게 돼요.

en: Anyone breaking the rules will be asked to leave on the spot.
ko: 규칙을 어기면 그 자리에서 바로 나가달라고 할 거예요.

en: All of the rules must be in line with company policy.
ko: 모든 규칙은 회사 방침이랑 맞아야 돼요.

en: The rules must be few, and what is more important, simple.
ko: 규칙은 적어야 하고, 더 중요한 건 단순해야 한다는 거예요.

en: The rules must be few, and more importantly, simple.
ko: 규칙은 적어야 하고, 무엇보다 단순한 게 중요해요.

en: Rules are to be observed.
We must observe the rules.
Technically he is still a student.
ko: 엄밀히 따지면 그 사람은 아직 학생이에요.

en: We punished him according to the rules.
You must follow the regulations.
Don't go against the rules.
You must not violate the regulations.
A fussy referee can ruin a bout.
ko: 까다로운 심판이 경기를 망칠 수도 있어요.

en: The rule requires that theses be written in English.
The rules require us all to be present.
Gas is a little cheaper with self-service, now that deregulation is kicking in.
ko: 규제 완화가 시작되면서 셀프 주유소 기름값이 좀 싸졌어요.

en: Noriko really is a nice person, isn't she?
In 776 B.C., the first Olympic Games were held at the foot of Mount Olympus to honor the Greeks' chief god, Zeus.
ko: 기원전 776년에 그리스의 주신 제우스를 기리기 위해 올림푸스 산기슭에서 첫 번째 올림픽이 열렸어요.

en: By the year 2020, the population of our city will have doubled.
ko: 2020년쯤이면 우리 도시 인구가 두 배로 늘어날 거예요.

en: We can clearly see the cycle of the seasons in Canada.
ko: 캐나다에서는 계절의 변화를 뚜렷하게 볼 수 있어요.

en: Just keep your fingers crossed.
A whistle blew, and the boat slowly began to pull out of port.
ko: 고동 소리가 울리더니 배가 천천히 항구에서 빠져나가기 시작했어요.

en: The steamer is now out of sight.
A steamship is, without doubt, a city in itself.
ko: 증기선은 확실히 그 자체로 하나의 도시예요.

en: Which goes faster, a ship or a train?
ko: 배랑 기차 중에 뭐가 더 빨라요?

en: Reading kills time on a train trip.
ko: 기차 여행할 때 독서는 시간 때우기 딱 좋아요.

en: The train was brought to a sudden halt.
The train was delayed because of heavy snowfall.
The train was held up for two hours on account of the snowstorm.
ko: 눈보라 때문에 기차가 두 시간이나 멈췄어요.

en: The train was not so crowded as I had expected.
The train was so crowded that I was kept standing all the way.
ko: 기차에 사람이 너무 많아서 계속 서서 왔어요.

en: The train will arrive on time without fail.
The train hasn't arrived yet.
The train left the station and was soon lost in sight.
ko: 기차가 역을 떠나더니 곧 안 보였어요.

en: The train has not arrived yet.
The train is ready to start.
The train was about to leave the station.
Trains come more often than buses.
The train traversed a tunnel.
The train was due at six.
The trains leave at two-hour intervals.
I had my purse and commutation ticket stolen while I was sleeping on the train.
ko: 기차에서 자는 동안 지갑이랑 정기권을 도둑맞았어요.

en: We were roused at daybreak by the whistle of a train.
ko: 새벽에 기차 고동 소리에 잠이 깼어요.

en: Beware lest you should miss the train.
Hurry up in order to catch the train.
I got there in time for the train.
The train was delayed, so I could not arrive there on time.
ko: 기차가 지연되는 바람에 제시간에 도착 못 했어요.

en: We should take into account that the train was delayed.
The train was derailed.
They waved good-bye to their parents as the train pulled out.
ko: 기차가 출발할 때 그들은 부모님께 손을 흔들어 작별 인사를 했어요.

en: As the train was crowded, I kept standing all the way to Kyoto.
ko: 기차에 사람이 많아서 교토까지 줄곧 서서 갔어요.

en: If your windows are not airtight, moisture will seep in.
ko: 창문이 꽉 안 닫혀 있으면 습기가 스며들 거예요.

en: Our train stopped suddenly.
Why don't we drive out to the country for a change of pace?
ko: 기분 전환 삼아 교외로 드라이브 갈까?

en: Let's take a walk for a change.
Mother advised me to take a walk for a change.
ko: 엄마가 기분 전환으로 산책 좀 다녀오라고 하셨어.

en: Let's eat out for a change.
Let's take a break for a change.
I wish you would take me to a restaurant for a change.
ko: 기분 전환 삼아 가끔은 외식하러 데려가 주면 좋겠어.

en: Are you feeling sick?
Are you feeling OK?
If you need a change of pace, why don't you come for a visit?
ko: 기분 전환이 필요하면 한번 놀러 와.

en: We are having a whale of a time.
ko: 우리 정말 즐거운 시간 보내고 있어.

en: How do you feel now?
When he feels fine, he goes for a walk.
ko: 그는 컨디션이 좋을 때 산책을 가.

en: When I feel fine, I go for a walk.
Not feeling well, I stayed home all day.
ko: 몸이 안 좋아서 하루 종일 집에 있었어.

en: I'm not feeling well.
I can't see you today because I feel ill.
ko: 몸이 안 좋아서 오늘은 못 만날 것 같아.

en: I'm not up for it.
I felt ill and was admitted to the hospital, but in the event, it was nothing serious.
ko: 몸이 안 좋아서 입원했는데, 결과적으로는 별일 아니었어.

en: Sick and tired, she went to bed early.
ko: 몸이 안 좋고 지쳐서 그녀는 일찍 자러 갔어.

en: Not feeling well, I stayed home on that day.
ko: 몸이 안 좋아서 그날은 집에 있었어.

en: Do you feel sick?
Because she felt sick.
I don't feel well. Could you give me some medicine?
ko: 몸이 안 좋은데 약 좀 줄 수 있어?

en: Not being well, she stayed home.
ko: 몸이 안 좋아서 그녀는 집에 있었어.

en: I'm feeling ill, but I intend to go out anyhow.
ko: 몸은 안 좋은데 그래도 나가려고 해.

en: I'm feeling fine now.
I'm feeling low.
I feel refreshed.
It is easy to get the cranky man's goat by teasing him.
ko: 그 까칠한 사람은 놀리면 금방 화를 내.

en: You have to be patient.
The generous dentist contributed some two billion yen to charity.
ko: 마음 넓은 치과의사가 자선 단체에 20억 엔 정도를 기부했어.

en: I think I'm going to faint.
He gives me the creeps.
The weather bureau says it will rain tonight.
I don't like girls who put on airs.
Try and calm down.
Everybody loved the simple scholar.
Don't change your mind.
I understand how you feel.
Speak your mind.
I really feel for you.
I know how you feel.
Isn't it a lovely morning?
It was a pleasant day, but there were few people in the park.
ko: 날씨는 좋았는데 공원에 사람이 거의 없었어.

en: For somebody who feels rushed all the time, I sure make slow progress.
ko: 항상 마음만 급하지, 진도는 정말 안 나가네.

en: Your mind is not occupied with your own affairs.
ko: 넌 네 일에 집중을 안 하고 있어.

en: A strange feeling came over me.
It's a lovely day.
Roll up your sleeves and get busy.
The weather will soon begin to calm down.
I really enjoy the climate.
The climate has much to do with our mind and body.
ko: 기후는 우리 몸이랑 마음에 큰 영향을 미쳐.

en: Don't be upset by sudden change of the weather.
ko: 갑작스러운 날씨 변화에 너무 속상해하지 마.

en: Because of the difference in climate, the same crop is not cultivated in the North and East of the country.
ko: 기후 차이 때문에 나라의 북쪽이랑 동쪽에서는 똑같은 작물을 재배하지 않아.

en: The climate affected the growth of trees and plants.
ko: 기후가 나무와 식물의 성장에 영향을 줬어.

en: Do you think our climate has an influence on our character?
ko: 우리 기후가 성격에 영향을 미친다고 생각해?

en: I can't get over how different the weather is here.
ko: 여기 날씨가 너무 달라서 정말 놀라워.

en: Please make yourself at home.
